verses.text: 信的人可以進入安息所以，那進入安息的應許，既然還給我們留著，我們就應該戰戰兢兢，恐怕我們中間有人像是被淘汰了。

breakdown.m: so as to, in order to

words.note: Often refers to divine or spiritual rest.
Often refers to a divine promise.
An idiom describing extreme caution or fear.

verses.text: 因為有福音傳給我們，像傳給他們一樣，只是他們所聽見的道，對他們沒有益處，因為他們沒有用信心與所聽見的打成一片（「沒有用信心與所聽見的打成一片」，有古卷作「沒有用信心與聽從這道的人打成一片」）。

words.note: Lit. 'blessed news'.
Specifically about spreading religious message.
Forms a noun phrase with a following verb.
Refers to divine teaching or truth.
Refers to religious faith.
Idiom: to merge or integrate completely.

verses.text: 然而我們信了的人，就可以進入那安息。正如　神所說：「我在烈怒中起誓說，他們絕不可進入我的安息！」其實　神的工作，從創立世界以來已經完成了。

words.note: The preceding space indicates reverence in Chinese Bibles.
Often refers to divine wrath.
Often in context of God swearing an oath.

verses.text: 因為論到第七日，他在聖經某一處說：「在第七日　神歇了他的一切工作。」
但在這裡又說：「他們絕不可進入我的安息。」
既然這安息還留著要讓一些人進去，但那些以前聽過福音的人，因為不順從不得進去；

words.note: A key theological concept in Hebrews chapter 4.
Lit. 'blessed news'.

words.definition: can, able to (often used in negative)
words.note: In classical Chinese, 得 can mean 'to be able to' and often appears in negative constructions.

verses.text: 所以　神就再定一個日子，就是過了很久以後，藉著大衛所說的「今天」，就像前面引用過的：「如果你們今天聽從他的聲音，就不要硬著心。」

words.note: Refers to the singular God, capitalized for reverence.
藉 and 借 are often interchangeable, meaning 'by means of'.
Common biblical idiom referring to spiritual stubbornness.

verses.text: 如果約書亞已經使他們享受了安息，　神後來就不會再提到別的日子了。
這樣看來，為了　神的子民，必定另外有一個「安息日」的安息保留下來。

words.note: A common idiom meaning 'from this perspective'.
Refers to God's chosen people or children.
The Hebrew 'Sabbath' refers to the day of rest.
下來 indicates a resultative complement of permanence or continuation.

verses.text: 因為那進入　神安息的人，就歇了自己的工作，好像　神歇了自己的工作一樣。
所以，我們要竭力進入那安息，免得有人隨著那不順從的樣子就跌倒了。

words.note: Lit. 'exhaust strength'

verses.text: 因為　神的道是活的，是有效的，比一切兩刃的劍更鋒利，甚至可以刺入剖開魂與靈，關節與骨髓，並且能夠辨明心中的思想和意念。

words.note: Elevated character indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 被造的在　神面前沒有一樣不是顯明的，萬有在他的眼前都是赤露敞開的；我們必須向他交帳。

words.note: Elevated character indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 我們的大祭司耶穌我們既然有一位偉大的、經過了眾天的大祭司，就是　神的兒子耶穌，就應該堅持所宣認的信仰。

words.note: Elevated character indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 因為我們的大祭司並不是不能同情我們的軟弱，他像我們一樣，也曾在各方面受過試探，只是他沒有犯罪。

words.note: Used for emphasis in negation.

verses.text: 所以，我們只管坦然無懼地來到施恩的寶座前，為的是要領受憐憫，得到恩惠，作為及時的幫助。

breakdown.m: by means of, in order to

words.note: Indicates a conclusion based on prior statement.
Suggests freedom from worry or hesitation.
An idiom meaning 'calmly and without fear'.
Connects an adjective/phrase to a verb, forming an adverbial.
Often used in religious contexts for God's grace.
Connects a modifier to a noun.
Lit. 'precious seat'.
Used as a postposition to indicate location.

words.definition: in order to, for the purpose of
words.note: A fixed phrase indicating purpose.
Often implies receiving something from a superior or a higher source.
Synonymous with 'pity'.
The '到' indicates successful completion of the action.
Similar to '恩典' (ēndiǎn), often implying a divine gift.
Connects a modifier to a noun.
